sen.j: 横倉 甚五郎（よこくら じんごろう、天保5年（1834年） - 明治3年8月15日 (旧暦)（1870年9月10日））は、武州多摩郡八王子市出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Jingoro YOKOKURA (1834-September 10, 1870), born in Hachioji City, Tama County, Bushu, was a member of Shinsengumi.
Jingoro YOKOKURA (1834-September 10, 1870), born in Hachioji City, Tama County, Bushu, was a member of Shinsengumi.
Jingoro YOKOKURA (1834-September 10, 1870), born in Hachioji City, Tama County, Bushu, was a member of Shinsengumi.
He learned martial art in Tennenrishin-ryu school.
He learned martial art in Tennenrishin-ryu school.
He learned martial art in Tennenrishin-ryu school.

sen.j: 元治元年（1865年）、局長近藤勇による隊士募集に応じて新選組に入隊。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi by applying for membership recruitment offered by Isami KONDO, the head of the group, in 1865.
He joined the Shinsengumi by applying for membership recruitment offered by Isami KONDO, the head of the group, in 1865.
sen.cmt: for の前、by の後のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi by applying for membership recruitment offered by Isami KONDO, the head of the group, in 1865.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）11月の油小路の変では大石鍬次郎らと共に出動。
sen.e: In the Aburanokoji Incident that occurred in December 1867, Jingoro operated together with Kuwajiro OISHI and other members.
In the Aburanokoji Incident that occurred in December 1867, Jingoro operated together with Kuwajiro OISHI and other members.
In the Aburanokoji Incident that occurred in December 1867, Jingoro operated together with Kuwajiro OISHI and other members.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）1月に戊辰戦争が勃発すると、鳥羽伏見の戦い、甲州勝沼の戦い、会津戦争を経て仙台で榎本武揚艦隊と合流し、蝦夷地へ渡航した。
sen.e: During the Boshin War that broke out in January 1868, Jingoro took part in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma and the Aizu War, and he subsequently headed for Sendai City where he joined Takeaki ENOMOTO's fleet and went to Ezo by ship.

During the Boshin War that broke out in January 1868, Jingoro took part in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma and the Aizu War, and he subsequently headed for Sendai City where he joined Takeaki ENOMOTO's fleet and went to Ezo by ship.

During the Boshin War that broke out in January 1868, Jingoro took part in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma and the Aizu War, and he subsequently headed for Sendai City where he joined Takeaki ENOMOTO's fleet and went to Ezo by ship.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）5月15日に弁天台場が降伏し、横倉は同所にて謹慎を言い渡されていた。
sen.e: When Benten Daiba (Cape Benten Battery) surrendered on June 24, 1869, Jingoro was ordered not to leave the place.
sen.cmt: 新暦変換済み 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Benten Daiba (Cape Benten Battery) surrendered on June 24, 1869, Jingoro was ordered not to leave the place.
When Benten Daiba (Cape Benten Battery) surrendered on June 24, 1869, Jingoro was ordered not to leave the place.

sen.j: 元京都見廻組今井信郎などと共に坂本龍馬、伊東甲子太郎暗殺の嫌疑をかけられ、同年11月9日、東京の糾問所に送検されて取り調べを受けた。
sen.e: Then, he and some former members of Kyoto-Mimawarigumi (a group that once existed to guard Kyoto City) such as Nobuo IMAI, were charged with assassination of Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kashitaro ITO and were transferred to an inquiry office in Tokyo for interrogation on December 11, 1869.
sen.cmt: 新暦変換済み 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, he and some former members of Kyoto-Mimawarigumi (a group that once existed to guard Kyoto City) such as Nobuo IMAI, were charged with assassination of Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kashitaro ITO and were transferred to an inquiry office in Tokyo for interrogation on December 11, 1869.

Then, he and some former members of Kyoto-Mimawarigumi (a group that once existed to guard Kyoto City) such as Nobuo IMAI, were charged with assassination of Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Kashitaro ITO and were transferred to an inquiry office in Tokyo for interrogation on December 11, 1869.
He died in prison on September 10, 1870.
He died in prison on September 10, 1870.
He died in prison on September 10, 1870.
He died at the age of 37.
He died at the age of 37.
He died at the age of 37.

sen.j: 弁天台場降伏時に詠まれた辞世の句が残る。
sen.e: He produced the following death poem at the fall of Benten Daiba.
He produced the following death poem at the fall of Benten Daiba.
He produced the following death poem at the fall of Benten Daiba.

sen.j: 義のために つくせしことも 水の泡 打ちよす波に 消えて流るゝ
sen.e: Ginotameni Tsukuseshikotomo Mizunoawa Uchiyosunamini Kietenagaruru (All the efforts I made for justice have been washed away like bubbles by surging waves.)
All the efforts I made for justice have been washed away like bubbles by surging waves.
sen.cmt: 前半部分を削除しました。
sen.e: All the efforts I made for justice have been washed away like bubbles by surging waves.
